title: Create a shareable Version 11 export folder containing all project files

requirements.text: Add a new repository folder that contains a complete, shareable snapshot of the Version 11 project files (backend + frontend + project metadata) in the same directory structure as the app.

quotes: Can you generate a folder adding all these files

acceptanceCriteria: A new folder exists at a clearly named path (e.g., export/version11/ or share/version11/)

The folder includes copies of all current project source/config files referenced in the repo (including backend/main.mo, backend/migration.mo, frontend/**, and project_state.json) while preserving the original relative paths
The export folder does not include build artifacts or dependency folders (e.g., node_modules, dist, .dfx, .mops, .git)

requirements.text: Include a single README in the export folder with English instructions for how to share the exported project without formatting changes (including WhatsApp-safe copying guidance) and how to compress the folder into a ZIP on common operating systems.

quotes: It should not change when I share it through WhatsApp.
Can you generate a folder adding all these files

acceptanceCriteria: README is present inside the export folder
README text is in English and includes explicit steps for WhatsApp code-safe sharing (monospace/code block guidance)
README includes basic ZIP instructions for Windows and macOS (and optionally Linux) using built-in tools

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything in frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead if needed).
Respect single-actor backend architecture (all Motoko logic stays in backend/main.mo; only change backend/migration.mo if state upgrades are required).
nonGoals: Implementing new app features (connections, chat changes, UI changes) unrelated to exporting/sharing the existing Version 11 code
Adding third-party file hosting, cloud storage, or external deployment automation
